result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for PTC 9/7     Set for STC 9/26 @ 3 pm.

10:55 AM Defendant Angela M. Hopinka in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney April Lande in court for Angela M. Hopinka. State in compliance with victim rights. State calls first witness JC Sheriff Deputy M B., sworn: states name and employment as sheriff deputy for Jackson County. Testified to being dispatched to the scene as to Victim 1 and contact/interview. Record reflects identification of defendant. Cross examination by Attorney Lande. No redirect. State moves for bind over. Defense objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Victim 1

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
Defense asking to reduce bond to $250.00. State does not object.

9:21 AM Defendant Angela M. Hopinka appeared by video, in custody from JCJ.   Attorney Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney April Lande appeared by video for Angela M. Hopinka. Waive reading of the complaint.  Atty to contact JA to schedule preliminary hearing.
